page.title: 16PONTYPOOL HERITAGE 1
page.content: In recent times there has been more interest in preserving our industrial heritage. Coal mining and iron industries were the basis of this valley's prosperity. The iron trades have gone and coal mining is declining but mementoes of this time are being preserved for tourism. The "Truck"shop at Pontymoile is to be restored.This was a shop used by iron workers who exchanged their pay of Tokens for household goods at prices fixed by the owners who were the Ironmasters. Colliers and miners cottages higher up the valley are preserved for us to see how ordinary working people used to live in the 18th and 19th centuries.Industrial artifacts are displayed at our Valley Inheritance Museum at Pontypool.
